column4: *sigh* something's gone quite wrong with my edgy upgrade -- NV driver didn't upgrade and is compiled for Xorg7.0; I can't apt-get anything because it throws a dependancy issue relating to python-card (which I don't need) and I can't 'apt-get -f install' as suggested as it has a conflict issue on a py-card config file. I backedup/rm'ed the conf file and still no luck... any advice?
try removing --purging python-card
erSUL: thankyou :)
erSUL: is that dpkg --purge <package> ?
first see if it works ;) (sudo apt-get remove --purge <package>)
!anyone | kyaneos_
any call to apt-get * causes the whinge about unmet dependancies (pythoncard) and suggests apt-get -f install
apt-get -f install throws an error on accessing the pythoncard config file; which I renamed (to no effect)
can you post the exact error (use pastebin)
certainly, but it'll take a little bit to retype into this machine...
just copy paste it
different physical machines; b0rked box is command line only
dohh :(
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/28661/
i mean the error that emits 'apt-get -f install'
DOH! sorry, will type it up now
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/28664/  <-- renaming the config file in question made no difference
did that error msg make any sense?
try removing python2.4-pythoncard
tried it.
that triggers the first error again
it's the eternal loop of broken config damnation
do not what else try rmove the deb from /var/cache/apt/ ?? (just in case it's corrupted)
nope :( thanks for your help though!
